segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 20. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 20. Brahmins

segments.pli: 195. Piṅgiyānīsutta
segments.en: 195. Piṅgiyānī

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pañcamattāni licchavisatāni bhagavantaṃ payirupāsanti.
segments.en: Now at that time around five hundred Licchavis were visiting the Buddha.

segments.pli: Appekacce licchavī nīlā honti nīlavaṇṇā nīlavatthā nīlālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī pītā honti pītavaṇṇā pītavatthā pītālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī lohitakā honti lohitakavaṇṇā lohitakavatthā lohitakālaṅkārā, appekacce licchavī odātā honti odātavaṇṇā odātavatthā odātālaṅkārā.
segments.en: Some of the Licchavis were in blue, of blue color, clad in blue, adorned with blue. And some were similarly colored in yellow, red, or white.

segments.pli: Tyassudaṃ bhagavā atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā ca.
segments.en: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.

segments.pli: Atha kho piṅgiyānī brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the brahmin Piṅgīyānī got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,

segments.pli: “paṭibhāti maṃ, bhagavā, paṭibhāti maṃ, sugatā”ti.
segments.en: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”

segments.pli: “Paṭibhātu taṃ piṅgiyānī”ti bhagavā avoca.
segments.en: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.

segments.pli: Atha kho piṅgiyānī brāhmaṇo bhagavato sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthavi:
segments.en: So the brahmin Piṅgīyānī extolled the Buddha in his presence with a fitting verse.

segments.pli: “Padmaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
segments.en: “Like a fragrant pink lotus

segments.pli: Pāto siyā phullamavītagandhaṃ;
segments.en: that blooms in the morning, its fragrance unfaded—

segments.pli: Aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
segments.en: see Aṅgīrasa shine,

segments.pli: Tapantamādiccamivantalikkhe”ti.
segments.en: bright as the sun in the sky!”

segments.pli: Atha kho te licchavī pañcahi uttarāsaṅgasatehi piṅgiyāniṃ brāhmaṇaṃ acchādesuṃ.
segments.en: Then those Licchavis clothed Piṅgiyānī with five hundred upper robes.

segments.pli: Atha kho piṅgiyānī brāhmaṇo tehi pañcahi uttarāsaṅgasatehi bhagavantaṃ acchādesi.
segments.en: And Piṅgiyānī clothed the Buddha with them.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te licchavī etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to the Licchavis:

segments.pli: “pañcannaṃ, licchavī, ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ pañcannaṃ?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: Tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desetā puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A person who explains the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.

segments.pli: Tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desitassa viññātā puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A person who understands the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.

segments.pli: Tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desitassa viññātā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A person who practices in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: Kataññū katavedī puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A person who is grateful and thankful.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, licchavī, pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
